details.title: Structure characterization of the folding intermediates of proteins
details.abstract: Although the native state and the fully unfolded state of proteins have been extensively studied, the folding pathway and intermediates in the protein folding process have not been thoroughly investigated. To understand the mechanisms of protein folding, the early intermediates in the protein folding process must be clearly characterized. The present paper is a mini review containing 20 references involving studies on folding intermediates of several proteins.
